info.title: Mila - Technology partners

get.description: Used to retrieve the detail of a rental approval that have been submitted by the real-estate professional, who is usually the subscriber of the Rental insurance group policy. Below is a representation of the various objects that are retrieved.

put.description: Allows the Partner to update a rental-approval that has been already submitted. The data used are the same as in POST rental-approval

tags: Real estate administrator / Real estate lots
get.description: Allows the Partner to retrieve the details of a real estate lot already created in Mila system, using the technical ID of the entity.

tags: Real estate administrator / Real estate lots
put.description: Allows the Partner to create a Lot in Mila’s System. Lots are the real estate units that will be rented in the lease (e.g. an Apartment, a house, etc.). They are  necessary for creating a rental approval and must be created beforehand. It is then important for the Partner to store in their system the Technical ID of the Lot after creation.

get.description: Allows the Partner to retrieve the details of a natural entity already created in Mila system, using the technical ID of the entity.

put.description: Allows the Partner to update the data of a natural entity using the technical ID of the entity.

get.description: Allows the Partner to retrieve the details of a legal entity that was created in Mila’s system, using the Technical ID of the person

put.description: Allows the Partner to update a legal entity that was already created in Mila’a System, using the Technical ID of the entity.

get.description: Used to retrieve the detail of a rental approval that have been submitted by the real-estate professional, who is usually the subscriber of the Rental insurance group policy. Below is a representation of the various objects that are retrieved.

put.description: Allows the Partner to update a rental-approval that has been already submitted. The data used are the same as in POST rental-approval

get.description: Allows the Partner to retrieve the details of a real estate lot already created in Mila system, using the technical ID of the entity.

They are  necessary for creating a rental approval and must be created beforehand. It is then important for the Partner to store in their system the Technical ID of the Lot after creation.

get.description: Allows the Partner to retrieve the details of a natural entity already created in Mila system, using the technical ID of the entity.

put.description: Allows the Partner to update the data of a natural entity using the technical ID of the entity.

get.description: Allows the Partner to retrieve the details of a legal entity that was created in Mila’s system, using the Technical ID of the person

put.description: Allows the Partner to update a legal entity that was already created in Mila’a System, using the Technical ID of the entity.

post.description: Before a real estate owner can lease their lot (also called a real estate unit) and take out rental insurance, they must first submit a rental approval request to Mila Customer Service. The rental approval request includes information regarding the lot, the tenant and their professional situation, their revenues, etc. If the request is approved, Mila Customer Service will provide the real estate owner with a certificate attesting that the tenant’s professional situation and revenues are in line with Mila’s requirements. Post rental-approvals allows the partner to create a rental approval in Mila SI.

get.description: Allows the partner to retrieve the list of the required documents that have already been submitted by the real estate professional. Note : GET rental-approval allows the Partner to retrieve the list of required documents according to the tenant situation. Nevertheless, it doesn’t retrieve the documents provided by the Real estate administrator.

post.description: Allows the Partner to upload document(s) to Mila’s system and to attach it to one or multiple required documents of a rental approval

requestBody.description:
Multipart payload as the following HTTP sample ((data) represent file binary content) :

        Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=----Boundary7MA4YWxkTrZu0gW

        ------Boundary7MA4YWxkTrZu0gW
        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="required_document_ids"

        123,789,333
        ------Boundary7MA4YWxkTrZu0gW
        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="file"; filename="pdf_test_file_1.pdf"
        Content-Type: application/pdf

        (data)
        ------Boundary7MA4YWxkTrZu0gW
        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="file"; filename="pdf_test_file_2.pdf"
        Content-Type: application/pdf

        (data)
        ------Boundary7MA4YWxkTrZu0gW--

post.description: Used after an approval request is created or modified in order to generate the corresponding Task in Mila’s Workflow for the Customer Service

post.summary: Add to rental insurance group policy
post.description: Once the rental approval is accepted by Mila, it is possible for the owner to start the lease and get rental insurance coverage. POST add-to-policy allows the Partner to transform a rental approval in Mila’s system (which has the status of ACCEPTED only) into a child policy (adhésion) attached to the rental insurance group policy.

post.summary: Terminate the fleet element at the specified exit date
post.description: Once a fleet element is added to a policy, the tenant can leave the Lot at anytime. When it occurs, this POST allows the partner to terminate the fleet element with an exit date.

tags: Real estate administrator / Real estate lots
post.description: Allows the partner to update a lot that has been already created in Mila’s system using the Technical ID. Data used are the same as POST real-estate-lots

Owners and Tenants can either be natural persons or legal persons. Post natural-entities allows the Partner to create a natural entity in Mila’s system. Once created the person can be used as an Owner or a Tenant while creating a rental approval. Note : in order to achieve this, it is necessary to store the Technical ID of the Natural person in the Partners system.

Owners and Tenants can either be natural persons or legal persons. Post legal-entities allows the Partner to create a legal entity in Mila’s system. Once created the person can be used as an Owner or a Tenant while creating a rental approval. Note : in order to achieve this, it is necessary to store the Technical ID of the legal person in the Partners system.

Before a real estate owner can lease their lot (also called a real estate unit) and take out rental insurance, they must first submit a rental approval request to Mila Customer Service. The rental approval request includes information regarding the lot, the tenant and their professional situation, their revenues, etc. If the request is approved, Mila Customer Service will provide the real estate owner with a certificate attesting that the tenant’s professional situation and revenues are in line with Mila’s requirements. Post rental-approvals allows the partner to create a rental approval in Mila SI.

post.summary: Return a list of pricing for each available composition of the property product
post.description:
Returns a list of pricing for each composition of the property product including the price, the product label, the product composition label and the quotation request.
Returns an empty list if no pricing is available.
The effective date must be after the current date.
The deductible must be *490*, *990* or *1500*.
The ratio of surface by main rooms number must be equal or lower than *50*.

post.summary: Return a list of pricing for each available composition of the landlord product
post.description:
Returns a list of pricing for each composition of the landlord product including the price, the product label, the product composition label and the quotation request.
The effective date must be after the current date.
The deductible must be *170* or *290*.
The ratio of surface by main rooms number must be equal or lower than *50*.

post.summary: Return a list of pricing for each available composition of the home product
post.description:
Returns a list of pricing for each composition of the home product including the price, the product label, the product composition label and the quotation request.
The effective date must be after the current date.
The deductible must be *170* or *290*.

post.summary: Retrieve JWT token for Real Estate Administrator (REA)
post.description: Allows you to retrieve your JWT token with a validity period, you must send this token in the Authorization header when making requests (Authorization: Bearer <token>). You must refresh your token before validity period expires based on jwt_token_expiration_delay_seconds

Allows you to retrieve your JWT token with a validity period, you must send this token in the Authorization header when making requests (Authorization: Bearer <token>). You must refresh your token before validity period expires based on jwt_token_expiration_delay_seconds

get.summary: Retrieve the fleet element added into the policy from the approval
get.description: Once the rental approval is added to a policy, it is possible to retrieve the added fleet element from the rental approval

Get download-certificate allows the Partner to download a rental approval certificate, when a rental approval is accepted by Mila the customer service provide a certificate that attest that the rental approval file was accepted. Once the certificate is provided by Mila the owner can go ahead and lease their real estate lot. Get download-certificate can only be called with a Technical ID of an approval request that has the status “ACCEPTED”.
Allows the partner to download a document that was previously uploaded to Mila’s system.

Allows the partner to retrieve business data for a rental approval.
Business data are used to compute the income rate and the maximum possible rent.
Used to retrieve the list of professional situations, as accepted by Mila, and which can be used in the rental approval.
Used to retrieve the list of additional incomes, as accepted by Mila, and which can be used in the fleet element entities of rental approval.

This is a documentation-only operation to describe the webhook sent to external clients.

**Webhook behavior:**
- Triggered via HTTP POST when an event occurs.
- The payload includes information such as event type and reference.

**Security:**
- A header HMAC SHA-256 `mila-api-signature` is included in the request.
- It contains a signature generated from the payload and a shared secret.
- Clients can use this to verify the authenticity and integrity of the request.

**Success:**
- Any HTTP 2xx response marks the webhook as successfully delivered.

**Failure and Retry Policy:**
- HTTP 4xx or 5xx responses are considered failures.
- Retries are scheduled as follows: less than 20 minutes later then around 1 hour, 5 hours then 1 day later.
- A maximum of 5 attempts is made.

post.summary: Endpoint expected to receive the webhook
post.description: This is a documentation-only operation to describe the webhook sent to external clients.

parameters.name: mila-api-signature
parameters.description: HMAC SHA-256 Signature of the payload, generated using a shared secret for verification

get.description: Used to retrieve the list of professional situations, as accepted by Mila, and which can be used in the rental approval.
Used to retrieve the list of additional incomes, as accepted by Mila, and which can be used in the fleet element entities of rental approval.

business_role.description:
Allowed business roles:
* `OWNER` - Owner - FR: Propriétaire
* `RISK` - The insured risk, often a real estate lot - FR: Lot assuré
* `TENANT` - Tenant only applied for rental insurance - FR: Locataire du lot assuré
* `SURETY` - Tenant's surety only applied for rental insurance - FR: Garant

RealEstateLotUsage.description:
Real estate lot usage:
* `HOME` - Home - FR: Habitation
* `HOME_AND_PROFESSIONAL` - Home and or professional - FR: Mixte habitation / professionnel
* `PROFESSIONAL` - Professional - FR: Professionnel
* `COMMERCIAL` - Commercial - FR: Commercial
* `UNOCCUPIED` - Unoccupied - FR: Inoccupé, don't use it for rental usage

real_estate_lot_type.description:
Type of the real estate lot.
Allowed values:
* `HOUSE` - House - FR: Maison
* `APARTMENT` - Apartment - FR: Appartement
* `REAL_ESTATE_PROPERTY` - Real estate property - FR: Immeuble
* `PARKING` - Parking - FR: Parking
* `ISOLATED_GARAGE` - Isolated garage - FR: Garage
* `BOX` - Box - FR: Box
* `REAL_ESTATE_COMMERCIAL` - Real estate commercial - FR: Local commercial
* `OTHER` - Other - FR: Autre

surface.description:
Surface of the real estate lot in square meters.
Is required for insurance pricing

main_rooms_number.description:
Number of main rooms in the real estate lot.
Is required for home and landlord insurance pricing

floor.description:
0 for ground floor, 1 for first floor, etc.
Is required for insurance pricing if the real estate lot type is APARTMENT

required_document_ids.description: List of one or multiple required document IDs separated with commas (ex: 123,789,333)

items.description: List of one or multiple required document IDs separated with commas (ex: 123,789,333)

file.description: One or multiple document content files

last_three_years_claim_number.description: Number of claims in the last three years.

last_three_years_claim_amount.description: Total amount of claims in the last three years.

renewable_energy_sources_presence.description:
Renewable energy sources presence.
Solar thermal or photovoltaic panels installations.

property_management_type.description:
Property management type.

Allowed values:
* `VOLUNTEER_TRUSTEE` - Volunteer trustee - FR: Syndic bénévole
* `PROFESSIONAL_TRUSTEE` - Professional trustee - FR: Syndic professionnel
* `ASL_OR_AFUL` - ASL or AFUL - FR: Association Syndicale Libre ou Association Foncière Urbaine Libre

hosts_an_institution.description: Hosts an institution like an embassy,a consulate or an association.

policy_terminated_by_previous_insurer.description: Policy terminated by the previous insurer.

effective_date.description:
The date must be after or equal to the current date.
Default is the current date.

deductible.description:
The deductible amount in euros.
Must be one of *0* *490*, *990* or *1500*.

optional_guarantee_codes.description:
List of optional guarantees codes.
Allowed values for property insurance:
* PJ - Protection juridique

items.description:
List of optional guarantees codes.
Allowed values for property insurance:
* PJ - Protection juridique

surface.description:
Surface of the real estate lot in square meters.
Is required for insurance pricing

floors_number.description:
Number of floors in the real estate property.
Is required for insurance pricing

basements_number.description: Number of basements in the real estate property.

buildings_number.description: Number of buildings in the real estate property.

property_typology.description:
Typology of the real estate property.

Allowed values:
* `STANDARD` - Standard - FR: Standard
* `STANDING_AND_HAUSSMANNIAN` - Standing and Haussmannian - FR: Standing et Haussmannien
* `LUXURIOUS` - Luxurious - FR: Luxueux
* `METAL_FRAME` - Metal frame - FR: Ossature métallique

construction_period.description:
Construction period of the real estate property.

Allowed values:
* `AFTER_2010` - After 2010 - FR: Après 2010
* `BETWEEN_1980_AND_2010` - Between 1980 and 2010 - FR: Entre 1980 et 2010
* `BETWEEN_1900_AND_1979` - Between 1900 and 1979 - FR: Entre 1900 et 1979
* `BEFORE_1900` - Before 1900 - FR: Avant 1900

product_label.description: Warning: Commercial label of the product, it's not a reliable identifier, it may change over time

product_composition_label.description: Warning: Commercial label of the product composition, it's not a reliable identifier, it may change over time

maximum_potential_claim_amount.description: Maximum potential claim amount, FR: SMP

effective_date.description:
The date must be after or equal to the current date.
Default is the current date.

deductible.description:
The deductible amount in euros.
Must be *170* or *290*.

EventWebhookRequest.description: Payload sent when an event occurs. This is sent via HTTP POST to client-defined webhooks url.

reference_id.description: ID of the related event reference type

reference_type.description:
Type of the reference. Possible values are:
- POLICY : Contrat
- APPROVAL : Sésame

event_type.description:
Event type triggering the webhook. Possible values are:
- APPROVAL_ACCEPTED : Sésame accepté
- APPROVAL_REFUSED : Sésame refusé
- APPROVAL_WAIT_REQUIRED_DOCUMENTS : En attente de documents requis
- APPROVAL_REQUIRED_DOCUMENTS_TO_VALIDATE : Documents à valider
